name: descope
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing descope cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`descope` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/descope/terraform-provider-descope).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing descope cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/descope/terraform-provider-descope)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-descope` repo](https://github.com/descope/pulumi-descope/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-descope` repo](https://github.com/descope/terraform-provider-descope/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/descope/terraform-provider-descope)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-descope` repo](https://github.com/descope/pulumi-descope/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-descope` repo](https://github.com/descope/terraform-provider-descope/issues).

oidcApplications.description: Applications using OpenID Connect (OIDC) for authentication.

claims.description: A list of supported claims. e.g. `sub`, `email`, `exp`.

description.description: A description for the OIDC application.

disabled.description: Whether the application should be enabled or disabled.

forceAuthentication.description: This configuration overrides the default behavior of the SSO application and forces the user to authenticate via the Descope flow, regardless of the SP's request.

id.description: An optional identifier for the OIDC application.

loginPageUrl.description: The Flow Hosting URL. Read more about using this parameter with custom domain [here](https://docs.descope.com/sso-integrations/applications/saml-apps).

logo.description: A logo for the OIDC application. Should be a hosted image URL.

name.description: A name for the OIDC application.

acsAllowedCallbackUrls.description: A list of allowed ACS callback URLS. This configuration is used when the default ACS URL value is unreachable. Supports wildcards.

attributeMappings.description: The `AttributeMapping` object. Read the description below.

defaultRelayState.description: The default relay state. When using IdP-initiated authentication, this value may be used as a URL to a resource in the Service Provider.

description.description: A description for the SAML application.

disabled.description: Whether the application should be enabled or disabled.

dynamicConfiguration.description: The `DynamicConfiguration` object. Read the description below.

forceAuthentication.description: This configuration overrides the default behavior of the SSO application and forces the user to authenticate via the Descope flow, regardless of the SP's request.

id.description: An optional identifier for the SAML application.

loginPageUrl.description: The Flow Hosting URL. Read more about using this parameter with custom domain [here](https://docs.descope.com/sso-integrations/applications/saml-apps).

logo.description: A logo for the SAML application. Should be a hosted image URL.

manualConfiguration.description: The `ManualConfiguration` object. Read the description below.

name.description: A name for the SAML application.

subjectNameIdFormat.description: The subject name id format. Choose one of "", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:persistent", "urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:transient". Read more about this configuration [here](https://docs.descope.com/sso-integrations/applications/saml-apps).

subjectNameIdType.description: The subject name id type. Choose one of "", "email", "phone". Read more about this configuration [here](https://docs.descope.com/sso-integrations/applications/saml-apps).

name.description: The name of the attribute.

metadataUrl.description: The metadata URL when retrieving the connection details dynamically.

acsUrl.description: Enter the `ACS URL` from the SP.

entityId.description: Enter the `Entity Id` from the SP.

tenants.description: A list of `TenantAttribute`. Read the description below.

users.description: A list of `UserAttribute`. Read the description below.

authorization.description: Determines the required permissions for this tenant.

id.description: An optional identifier for the attribute. This value is called `Machine Name` in the Descope console. If a value is not provided then an appropriate one will be created from the value of `name`.

name.description: The name of the attribute. This value is called `Display Name` in the Descope console.

selectOptions.description: When the attribute type is "multiselect". A list of options to choose from.

type.description: The type of the attribute. Choose one of "string", "number", "boolean", "singleselect", "multiselect", "date".

viewPermissions.description: Determines the required permissions for this tenant.

id.description: An optional identifier for the attribute. This value is called `Machine Name` in the Descope console. If a value is not provided then an appropriate one will be created from the value of `name`.

name.description: The name of the attribute. This value is called `Display Name` in the Descope console.

selectOptions.description: When the attribute type is "multiselect". A list of options to choose from.

type.description: The type of the attribute. Choose one of "string", "number", "boolean", "singleselect", "multiselect", "date".

widgetAuthorization.description: Determines the permissions users are required to have to access this attribute in the user management widget.

editPermissions.description: The permissions users are required to have to edit this attribute in the user management widget.

viewPermissions.description: The permissions users are required to have to view this attribute in the user management widget.

embeddedLink.description: Make the authentication experience smoother for the user by generating their initial token in a way that does not require the end user to initiate the process, requiring only verification.

enchantedLink.description: An enhanced and more secure version of Magic Link, enabling users to start the authentication process on one device and execute the verification on another.

magicLink.description: An authentication method where a user receives a unique link via email to log in.

oauth.description: Authentication using Open Authorization, which allows users to authenticate with various external services.

otp.description: A dynamically generated set of numbers, granting the user one-time access.

passkeys.description: Device-based passwordless authentication, using fingerprint, face scan, and more.

password.description: The classic username and password combination used for authentication.

sso.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication method that enables users to access multiple applications with a single set of credentials.

totp.description: A one-time code generated for the user using a shared secret and time.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

expirationTime.description: How long the embedded link remains valid before it expires.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

emailService.description: Settings related to sending emails as part of the enchanted link authentication.

expirationTime.description: How long the enchanted link remains valid before it expires.

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect users to after they log in using the enchanted link.

connector.description: The name of the email connector to use for sending emails.

templates.description: A list of email templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this email template is currently active and in use.

htmlBody.description: HTML content of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` isn't set.

name.description: Unique name for this email template.

plainTextBody.description: Plain text version of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` is set to `true`.

subject.description: Subject line of the email message.

usePlainTextBody.description: Whether to use the plain text body instead of HTML for the email.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

emailService.description: Settings related to sending emails as part of the magic link authentication.

expirationTime.description: How long the magic link remains valid before it expires.

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect users to after they log in using the magic link.

textService.description: Settings related to sending SMS messages as part of the magic link authentication.

connector.description: The name of the email connector to use for sending emails.

templates.description: A list of email templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this email template is currently active and in use.

htmlBody.description: HTML content of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` isn't set.

name.description: Unique name for this email template.

plainTextBody.description: Plain text version of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` is set to `true`.

subject.description: Subject line of the email message.

usePlainTextBody.description: Whether to use the plain text body instead of HTML for the email.

connector.description: The name of the SMS/text connector to use for sending text messages.

templates.description: A list of text message templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this text template is currently active and in use.

body.description: The content of the text message.

name.description: Unique name for this text template.

custom.description: Custom OAuth providers configured for this project.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

system.description: Custom configurations for builtin OAuth providers such as Apple, Google, GitHub, Facebook, etc.

allowedGrantTypes.description: The type of grants (`authorization_code` or `implicit`) to allow when requesting access tokens from the OAuth provider.

authorizationEndpoint.description: The URL that users are redirected to for authorization with the OAuth provider.

callbackDomain.description: Use a custom domain in your OAuth verification screen.

claimMapping.description: Maps OAuth provider claims to Descope user attributes.

clientId.description: The client ID for the OAuth provider, used to identify the application to the provider.

clientSecret.description: The client secret for the OAuth provider, used to authenticate the application with the provider.

description.description: A brief description of the OAuth provider.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

issuer.description: The issuer identifier for the OAuth provider.

jwksEndpoint.description: The URL where the application can retrieve JSON Web Key Sets (JWKS) for the OAuth provider.

logo.description: The URL of the logo associated with the OAuth provider.

manageProviderTokens.description: Whether to enable provider token management for this OAuth provider.

mergeUserAccounts.description: Whether to merge existing user accounts with new ones created through OAuth authentication.

prompts.description: Custom prompts or consent screens that users may see during OAuth authentication.

providerTokenManagement.description: This attribute is deprecated, use the `manage_provider_tokens`, `callback_domain`, and `redirect_url` fields instead.

redirectUrl.description: Users will be directed to this URL after authentication. If redirect URL is specified in the SDK/API call, it will override this value.

scopes.description: Scopes of access that the application requests from the user's account on the OAuth provider.

tokenEndpoint.description: The URL where the application requests an access token from the OAuth provider.

userInfoEndpoint.description: The URL where the application retrieves user information from the OAuth provider.

apple.description: Apple's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Apple Account.

discord.description: Discord's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Discord account.

facebook.description: Facebook's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Facebook account.

github.description: GitHub's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their GitHub account.

gitlab.description: GitLab's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their GitLab account.

google.description: Google's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Google account.

linkedin.description: LinkedIn's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their LinkedIn account.

microsoft.description: Microsoft's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Microsoft account.

slack.description: Slack's OAuth provider, allowing users to authenticate with their Slack account.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

domain.description: The domain to embed in OTP messages.

emailService.description: Settings related to sending emails with OTP codes.

expirationTime.description: The amount of time that an OTP code will be valid for.

textService.description: Settings related to sending SMS messages with OTP codes.

voiceService.description: Settings related to voice calls with OTP codes.

connector.description: The name of the email connector to use for sending emails.

templates.description: A list of email templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this email template is currently active and in use.

htmlBody.description: HTML content of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` isn't set.

name.description: Unique name for this email template.

plainTextBody.description: Plain text version of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` is set to `true`.

subject.description: Subject line of the email message.

usePlainTextBody.description: Whether to use the plain text body instead of HTML for the email.

connector.description: The name of the SMS/text connector to use for sending text messages.

templates.description: A list of text message templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this text template is currently active and in use.

body.description: The content of the text message.

name.description: Unique name for this text template.

connector.description: The name of the voice connector to use for making voice calls.

templates.description: A list of voice message templates for different purposes.

active.description: Whether this voice template is currently active and in use.

body.description: The content of the voice message that will be spoken.

name.description: Unique name for this voice template.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

topLevelDomain.description: Passkeys will be usable in the following domain and all its subdomains.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

emailService.description: Settings related to sending password reset emails as part of the password feature.

expiration.description: Whether users are required to change their password periodically.

expirationWeeks.description: The number of weeks after which a user's password expires and they need to replace it.

lock.description: Whether the user account should be locked after a specified number of failed login attempts.

lockAttempts.description: The number of failed login attempts allowed before an account is locked.

lowercase.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one lowercase letter.

minLength.description: The minimum length of the password that users are required to use. The maximum length is always `64`.

nonAlphanumeric.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one non-alphanumeric character (e.g. `!`, `@`, `#`).

number.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one number.

reuse.description: Whether to forbid password reuse when users change their password.

reuseAmount.description: The number of previous passwords whose hashes are kept to prevent users from reusing old passwords.

uppercase.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one uppercase letter.

connector.description: The name of the email connector to use for sending emails.

templates.description: A list of email templates for different authentication flows.

active.description: Whether this email template is currently active and in use.

htmlBody.description: HTML content of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` isn't set.

name.description: Unique name for this email template.

plainTextBody.description: Plain text version of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` is set to `true`.

subject.description: Subject line of the email message.

usePlainTextBody.description: Whether to use the plain text body instead of HTML for the email.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

mergeUsers.description: Whether to merge existing user accounts with new ones created through SSO authentication.

redirectUrl.description: The URL the end user is redirected to after a successful authentication. If one is specified in tenant level settings or SDK/API call, they will override this value.

ssoSuiteSettings.description: Configuration block for the SSO Suite.

hideDomains.description: Setting this to `true` will hide the domains configuration section in the SSO Suite interface.

hideGroupsMapping.description: Setting this to `true` will hide the groups mapping configuration section in the SSO Suite interface.

hideOidc.description: Setting this to `true` will hide the OIDC configuration option.

hideSaml.description: Setting this to `true` will hide the SAML configuration option.

hideScim.description: Setting this to `true` will hide the SCIM configuration in the SSO Suite interface.

styleId.description: Specifies the style ID to apply in the SSO Suite. Ensure a style with this ID exists in the console for it to be used.

disabled.description: Setting this to `true` will disallow using this authentication method directly via API and SDK calls. Note that this does not affect authentication flows that are configured to use this authentication method.

description.description: A description for the permission.

name.description: A name for the permission.

default.description: Whether this role should automatically be assigned to users that are created without any roles.

description.description: A description for the role.

name.description: A name for the role.

permissions.description: A list of permissions by name to be included in the role.

private.description: Whether this role should not be displayed to tenant admins.

abuseipdbs.description: Utilize IP threat intelligence to block malicious login attempts with the AbuseIPDB connector.

amplitudes.description: Track user activity and traits at any point in your user journey with the Amplitude connector.

auditWebhooks.description: Send audit events to a custom webhook.

awsS3s.description: Stream authentication audit logs with the Amazon S3 connector.

awsTranslates.description: Localize the language of your login and user journey screens with the Amazon Translate connector.

bitsights.description: Utilize threat intelligence to block malicious login attempts or check leaks with the Bitsight Threat Intelligence connector.

datadogs.description: Stream authentication audit logs with the Datadog connector.

devrevGrows.description: DevRev Grow is a Growth CRM that brings salespeople, product marketers, and PMs onto an AI-native platform to follow the journey of a visitor to a lead, to a contact, and then to a user - to create a champion, not a churned user.

docebos.description: Get user information from Docebo in your Descope user journeys with the Docebo connector.

eightByEightVibers.description: Send Viber messages to the user.

eightByEightWhatsapps.description: Send WhatsApp messages to the user.

elephants.description: Use this connector to obtain an identity trust score.

fingerprintDescopes.description: Descope Fingerprint capabilities for fraud detection and risk assessment.

fingerprints.description: Prevent fraud by adding device intelligence with the Fingerprint connector.

firebaseAdmins.description: Firebase connector enables you to utilize Firebase's APIs to generate a Firebase user token for a given Descope user.

forters.description: Leverage ML-based risk scores for fraud prevention with the Forter connector.

genericEmailGateways.description: Send emails using a generic Email gateway.

genericSmsGateways.description: Send messages using a generic SMS gateway.

googleCloudLoggings.description: Stream logs and audit events with the Google Cloud Logging connector.

googleCloudTranslations.description: Localize the language of your login and user journey screens with the Google Cloud Translation connector.

googleMapsPlaces.description: Get address autocompletions from Place Autocomplete Data API.

hibps.description: Check if passwords have been previously exposed in data breaches with the Have I Been Pwned connector.

hubspots.description: Orchestrate customer identity information from your Descope user journey with the HubSpot connector.

incodes.description: Use the Incode connection to run identity verification processes like document checks or facial recognition.

intercoms.description: Orchestrate customer identity information from your Descope user journey with the Intercom connector.

lokalises.description: Localize the language of your login and user journey screens with the Lokalise connector.

mparticles.description: Track and send user event data (e.g. page views, purchases, etc.) across connected tools using the mParticle connector.

newrelics.description: Stream authentication audit logs with the New Relic connector.

radars.description: Get address autocompletions from Radar Autocomplete API.

recaptchaEnterprises.description: Mitigate fraud using advanced risk analysis and add adaptive MFA with the reCAPTCHA Enterprise connector.

recaptchas.description: Prevent bot attacks on your login pages with the reCAPTCHA v3 connector.

rekognitions.description: Add image recognition capabilities for identity verification and fraud prevention with the Amazon Rekognition connector.

salesforceMarketingClouds.description: Send transactional messages with the Salesforce Marketing Cloud connector.

salesforces.description: Run SQL queries to retrieve user roles, profiles, account status, and more with the Salesforce connector.

segments.description: Orchestrate customer identity traits and signals from your Descope user journey with the Segment connector.

sendgrids.description: SendGrid is a cloud-based SMTP provider that allows you to send emails without having to maintain email servers.

ses.description: Amazon Simple Email Service (SES) for sending emails through AWS infrastructure.

slacks.description: Send updates to your team on Slack.

smartlings.description: Localize the language of your login and user journey screens with the Smartling connector.

smtps.description: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server for sending emails.

sns.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) for sending SMS messages through AWS.

sumologics.description: Stream logs and audit events with the Sumo Logic connector.

supabases.description: Generate external tokens for user authentication in Supabase projects.

telesigns.description: Verify phone numbers and leverage granular risk scores for adaptive MFA with the Telesign Intelligence connector.

traceables.description: Identify and respond to fraudulent login activity with the Traceable Digital Fraud Prevention connector.

turnstiles.description: Prevent bot attacks on your login pages with the Turnstile connector.

twilioCores.description: Twilio is a cloud-based communication provider of communication tools for making and receiving phone calls, sending and receiving text messages, and performing other communication functions.

twilioVerifies.description: Twilio Verify is an OTP service that can be used via text messages, instant messaging platforms, voice and e-mail. Choose this connector only if you are a Twilio Verify customer.

htmlBody.description: HTML content of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` isn't set.

name.description: Unique name for this email template.

plainTextBody.description: Plain text version of the email message body, required if `use_plain_text_body` is set to `true`.

subject.description: Subject line of the email message.

usePlainTextBody.description: Whether to use the plain text body instead of HTML for the email.

accessKeyTemplates.description: A list of `Access Key` type JWT Templates.

userTemplates.description: A list of `User` type JWT Templates.

authSchema.description: The authorization claims format - `default`, `tenantOnly` or `none`. Read more about schema types [here](https://docs.descope.com/project-settings/jwt-templates).

autoTenantClaim.description: When a user is associated with a single tenant, the tenant will be set as the user's active tenant, using the `dct` (Descope Current Tenant) claim in their JWT.

conformanceIssuer.description: Whether to use OIDC conformance for the JWT issuer field.

description.description: Description of the JWT Template.

enforceIssuer.description: Whether to enforce that the JWT issuer matches the project configuration.

name.description: Name of the JWT Template.

template.description: The JSON template defining the structure and claims of the JWT token. This is expected to be a valid JSON object given as a `string` value.

authSchema.description: The authorization claims format - `default`, `tenantOnly` or `none`. Read more about schema types [here](https://docs.descope.com/project-settings/jwt-templates).

autoTenantClaim.description: When a user is associated with a single tenant, the tenant will be set as the user's active tenant, using the `dct` (Descope Current Tenant) claim in their JWT.

conformanceIssuer.description: Whether to use OIDC conformance for the JWT issuer field.

description.description: Description of the JWT Template.

enforceIssuer.description: Whether to enforce that the JWT issuer matches the project configuration.

name.description: Name of the JWT Template.

template.description: The JSON template defining the structure and claims of the JWT token. This is expected to be a valid JSON object given as a `string` value.

accessKeyJwtTemplate.description: Name of the access key JWT Template.

accessKeySessionTokenExpiration.description: The expiry time for access key session tokens. Use values such as "10 minutes", "4 hours", etc. The value needs to be at least 3 minutes and can't be longer than 4 weeks.

appUrl.description: The URL which your application resides on.

approvedDomains.description: The list of approved domains that are allowed for redirect and verification URLs for different authentication methods.

customDomain.description: A custom CNAME that's configured to point to `cname.descope.com`. Read more about custom domains and cookie policy [here](https://docs.descope.com/how-to-deploy-to-production/custom-domain).

defaultNoSsoApps.description: Define whether a user created with no federated apps, will have access to all apps, or will not have access to any app.

enableInactivity.description: Use `True` to enable session inactivity. To read more about session inactivity click [here](https://docs.descope.com/project-settings#session-inactivity).

inactivityTime.description: The session inactivity time. Use values such as "15 minutes", "1 hour", etc. The minimum value is "10 minutes".

refreshTokenCookieDomain.description: The domain name for refresh token cookies. To read more about custom domain and cookie policy click [here](https://docs.descope.com/how-to-deploy-to-production/custom-domain).

refreshTokenCookiePolicy.description: Use `strict`, `lax` or `none`. Read more about custom domains and cookie policy [here](https://docs.descope.com/how-to-deploy-to-production/custom-domain).

refreshTokenExpiration.description: The expiry time for the refresh token, after which the user must log in again. Use values such as "4 weeks", "14 days", etc. The minimum value is "3 minutes".

refreshTokenResponseMethod.description: Configure how refresh tokens are managed by the Descope SDKs. Must be either `response_body` or `cookies`. The default value is `response_body`.

refreshTokenRotation.description: Every time the user refreshes their session token via their refresh token, the refresh token itself is also updated to a new one.

sessionMigration.description: Configure seamless migration of existing user sessions from another vendor to Descope.

sessionTokenCookieDomain.description: The domain name for session token cookies. To read more about custom domain and cookie policy click [here](https://docs.descope.com/how-to-deploy-to-production/custom-domain).

sessionTokenCookiePolicy.description: Use `strict`, `lax` or `none`. Read more about custom domains and cookie policy [here](https://docs.descope.com/how-to-deploy-to-production/custom-domain).

sessionTokenExpiration.description: The expiry time of the session token, used for accessing the application's resources. The value needs to be at least 3 minutes and can't be longer than the refresh token expiration.

sessionTokenResponseMethod.description: Configure how sessions tokens are managed by the Descope SDKs. Must be either `response_body` or `cookies`. The default value is `response_body`.

stepUpTokenExpiration.description: The expiry time for the step up token, after which it will not be valid and the user will automatically go back to the session token.

testUsersLoginidRegexp.description: Define a regular expression so that whenever a user is created with a matching login ID it will automatically be marked as a test user.

testUsersStaticOtp.description: A 6 digit static OTP code for use with test users.

testUsersVerifierRegexp.description: The pattern of the verifiers that will be used for testing.

trustedDeviceTokenExpiration.description: The expiry time for the trusted device token. The minimum value is "3 minutes".

userJwtTemplate.description: Name of the user JWT Template.

audience.description: The audience value if needed by the vendor.

clientId.description: The unique client ID for the vendor.

domain.description: The domain value if needed by the vendor.

issuer.description: An issuer URL if needed by the vendor.

loginidMatchedAttributes.description: A set of attributes from the vendor's user that should be used to match with the Descope user's login ID.

vendor.description: The name of the vendor the sessions are migrated from, in all lowercase.

data.description: The JSON data defining the visual styling and theme configuration used for authentication, widgets, etc.

provider.description:
The provider type for the descope package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

applications.description: Applications that are registered with the project.

attributes.description: Custom attributes that can be attached to users and tenants.

authorization.description: Define Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for your users by creating roles and permissions.

connectors.description: Enrich your flows by interacting with third party services.

environment.description: This can be set to `production` to mark production projects, otherwise this should be left unset for development or staging projects.

flows.description: Custom authentication flows to use in this project.

jwtTemplates.description: Defines templates for JSON Web Tokens (JWT) used for authentication.

name.description: The name of the Descope project.

projectSettings.description: General settings for the Descope project.

styles.description: Custom styles that can be applied to the project's authentication flows.

tags.description: Descriptive tags for your Descope project. Each tag must be no more than 50 characters long.

pulumi:providers:descope/terraformConfig.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.
